recommendations.html: WPS Pin entry should be disabled on the wireless router, or only enabled temporarily to add new devices to the network.

summary.html: WPS was built as an addition to WPA to make it easier to add devices without typing in secure passwords, but this ease of use means that a malicious actor can pose as a device and effectively reduce the potentially very difficult passwords WPA allows down to a simple numeric-only 8 character PIN. Further, the WPS system allows an attacker to work on this PIN in two parallel chunks, further reducing its security. This, like WEP, is a "live" attack - you have to stay connected to the network - but also like WEP, it is a guaranteed attack; your brute forcing of the WPS system will eventually (2-10 hours) allow you network access.

walk_through.html:
• Find the BSSID of the target routerr
  • Use Wash to find WPS Routers
  • Start Reaver : estimated time: Between 2 and 10 hours
